page.title: 01UPPER REACHES OF RIVER BOX
page.content: The River Box Valley disects the area West of Boxford. The area is a pemeplane c. 60m above sea level. The predominant land use is intensive arable farming with small areas of ancient woodlasnd, copice and scrub along the valley. In the N.E. of the area are the villages of Grotom, pop 200 and Edwardstone, pop. 350. Most of the working population are employed in local towns, some commuting to London, the remainder in local service industries and a very few in agriculture. 20% of the villages are under 15 years old. The S.W. corner of the survey area includes the fringe of Newton Green. The population here are 40% pensioners. Newton is well served by bus route on the A134.
